results.content:
The resolution of the video seams not to be the best. I am missing more real world examples.

Nevertheless i learned something from this course regarding GWT and JsInterop.

response.content: Thanks for the review. I am glad you learned something. This was my first course :) I will consider more the video quality aspect in the next ones.

results.content_html:
The resolution of the video seams not to be the best. I am missing more real world examples.

Nevertheless i learned something from this course regarding GWT and JsInterop.

results.content: As a developer who maintains a legacy GWT stack (2.7) and wanting to update to 2.8 to leverage JsInterop, this was a very helpful course.   I particularly liked the coding examples as well as the Chrome devtools tips.    The only reason I didn't give 5 stars is that; I felt it would have been helpful to include additional section(s) about the new maven plugins, a full stack example complete with a server side component(s), and multi-module structuring of the project.

response.content: Many thanks for the feedback. I agree there could be more to be said on the maven plugins. As for the backend, GWT is moving towards becoming a front end framework, since it will somehow ditch its old server modules, so I thought it is better to leave it off the course. If you mean some full stack application with the backend implemented in different frameworks like Java (Jakarta) EE or Spring, then this would not be a bad idea after all. I am glad the course was helpful!
response.content_html: Many thanks for the feedback. I agree there could be more to be said on the maven plugins. As for the backend, GWT is moving towards becoming a front end framework, since it will somehow ditch its old server modules, so I thought it is better to leave it off the course. If you mean some full stack application with the backend implemented in different frameworks like Java (Jakarta) EE or Spring, then this would not be a bad idea after all. I am glad the course was helpful!

results.content: I enjoyed the course and it helped with what I was expecting. It was a great intro to JsInterop.
